quiz.title: Unit 1: Foundations & Measurement (Quiz 4)
quiz.subtitle: Advanced Unit Conversions - Large and Small Scales (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: How many hours are there in 1 year (non-leap year)?
What is 1 picometer (pm) in meters?
questions.explanation: The prefix 'pico-' means 10⁻¹². So 1 pm = 1 × 10⁻¹² m.

questions.question: What is 1 terameter (Tm) in meters?
questions.explanation: The prefix 'tera-' means 10¹². So 1 Tm = 1 × 10¹² m.

questions.question: Convert 5,700 cm/min to m/s.
questions.explanation: cm → m: divide by 100. min → s: divide by 60. 5,700 ÷ 100 = 57 m/min. 57 ÷ 60 = 0.95 m/s.

questions.question: How many seconds are there in 1 week?
questions.explanation: 1 week = 7 days × 24 hours × 60 minutes × 60 seconds = 7 × 86,400 = 604,800 s.

questions.question: A light-year is the distance light travels in one year. If light travels at approximately 3 × 10⁸ m/s, how many meters are in one light-year? (Use 1 year = 365 days)
A nanosecond (ns) is one billionth of a second. How many nanoseconds are in 1 second?
questions.explanation: The prefix 'nano-' means 10⁻⁹, so 1 second = 10⁹ nanoseconds.
